SmProcessing

Class V1Process

  • java.lang.Object
    • SmProcessing.V1Process

  • public class V1Process
extends java.lang.Object
    The V1Process class executes the steps necessary to generate a V1 product file from a V0 input file. It retrieves the recorder LSB and sensor sensitivity values from the Real Header and the data units name and code from the configuration file. Based on the units specified, the raw trace counts are converted to physical values. Then the mean of the data array is removed. The mean value that was removed from the array is saved for updating the header, and the final array peak value, peak value index, and new mean (which should be 0.0) are calculated as well.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      V1Process(V0Component v0rec)
      The extended constructor for V1Process retrieves the recorder LSB (least significant bit) and the sensor sensitivity from the Real Header and screens for invalid values.

    • Constructor Detail

      • V1Process

        public V1Process(V0Component v0rec)
          throws SmException
        The extended constructor for V1Process retrieves the recorder LSB (least significant bit) and the sensor sensitivity from the Real Header and screens for invalid values. It also retrieves the data units name and code from the configuration file if available. If these values are not defined, default values are used instead.
        Parameters:
        v0rec - the reference to the parent V0 record
        Throws:
        SmException - if unable to acquire needed real header or configuration parameters

    • Method Detail

      • processV1Data

        public void processV1Data()
        This method performs the actual processing by calling methods from the processing api to convert the counts to physical values and remove the mean.
